Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [at Dunder-Mifflin Corporate in NY] David!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [confused] Oh, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we all set?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Isn't our interview tomorrow?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I just happened to be in the neighborhood, thought I'd drop in and say hello.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You happened to be in mid-town Mahattan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thought I'd catch a show.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: In the middle of a work day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Naaah. You know what? Since I'm here, let me ask you a few questions about the job.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, how many people are you interviewing?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: We're only interviewing the branch managers and some other upper level company people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, well, good. Out of curiosity are you interviewing anyone who has been here longer than I have, or manages more people?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great. One more... question. When you merged those branches who did you put in charge?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I believe we put you in charge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, great. No further questions.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'm really looking forward to our interview.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I'm really looking forward to working with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got it made in the shade. I know this company. The other branch managers are total morons. [on cell phone] Hey, Pam yeah, I forgot what day the interview was and I drove to New York accidentially. I'll be like three hours late.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Jim walk through the door sporting an obvious new haircut] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's different about you? You look worse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You got a haircut. It's sexy, hot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ohhh...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Turn around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Do it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Blup-dup-do. What's up, Big Haircut? You are no longer Big Tuna. From henceforth, you shall be known as Big Haircut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [exhales loudly] Andy...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What is it, Big Haircut?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sorry, I can't hear you Big Haircut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Karen suggested that I get a haircut for the interview tomorrow so that I could look presentable and not, as she so lovingly puts it, homeless.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. I think it looks great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: After I had my little outburst at the beach, Jim was really nice about it. He just basically said that he missed my friendship too and I would always mean a lot to him and I understand where he's coming from. For the record, I am not embarassed at all. It needed to be said, and I said it, and it only took me three years to summons the courage, so [quietly, and mock bowing] thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock on door] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, the time has come to name my own replacement. So please hand this letter of congratulations to Dwight K. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But that's my name. [opens letter and reads] Dwight, congratuations a-wipe. Don't screw the pooch. [begins to cry] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [cries harder] Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sobbing, holding letter to chest] Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop crying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sobbing] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhhhh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, about the beach...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: It's okay, we all say things without thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no it's not that, I've actually been thinking that for a long time, and I'm glad I said it. I just... I'm sorry if it made you feel weird.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [confused] Oh. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Pam is... kind of a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, what if we leave tonight? Grab a bite, get a hotel room, enjoy the city a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ahhh... just have so much paperwork to do. [exhales] Wow. Done. Okay, let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I was wondering if Karen and I could get off a few hours early 'cause we want to spend the night in the city.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why so you can do it?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [looks annoyed]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoops.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, um, well I was thinking that uh, actually we could all leave tomorrow and do a convoy you know? Convoys are really fun. Pull up next to each other, give each other the finger...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Heh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Moon each other.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, we're gonna go tonight, but we're gonna see you there tomorrow morning, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your loss.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Wait, how would you moon us if you were driving?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cruise control.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So Jim, who do you think is hotter? Pam or Karen?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm not going to talk about this now.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam is taller.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes. She has bigger breasts, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think Karen has a prettier face.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, hmm. [thinking] Uh, hmm. What else?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well I mean Pam's face is really pretty too. It's a very tough call.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hm. Really tough call.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Why don't you take the rest of the day, figure it out and then come back and tell me what you got.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam I've been meaning to say something to you. I really miss our friendship. [group laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, very funny.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I've never heard you talk that much. I thought it was Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? I would have never done that. It was pathetic-ville. No offense, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You know what? Don't even worry about it. Everyone was so drunk, I bet no one even remembers what you said.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I remember. I blogged the whole thing.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: www.creedthoughts.gov.www/creedthoughts. Check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Last year Creed asked me how to set up a blog. Wanting to protect the world from being exposed to Creed's brain I opened up a Word document on his computer and put an address at the top. I've read some of it. Even for the intranet it's... pretty shocking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There they are, the Accounting Department. I shall miss your humility and your promptly printed checks.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you think it's gonna to be weird working with Jan in New York?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Not at all. I haven't talked to Jan since we broke up, and I think if she had something to say she would have called me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe you should talk to her? Before...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. You know what? It's a done deal. I basically have the job already. There's nothing she can do to stop it now. I already sold my condo.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, that just doesn't make sense.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Wha? Who gave you that advice?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael you should never sell your condo...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have to buy another place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But you said you were in debt. [crosstalk]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're not sure that you have the job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I sold it on eBay. The buyer was very motivated, as was I. It went for eighty percent of what I paid. Sold in record time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How would you like to spend the night with the Regional Manager of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No Dwight, I don't care if that is how they consolidated power in ancient Rome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, not Michael. [whispers] Me. I'm taking his job.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [smiles] Not now. [Dwight leaves] Goodbye, Kelly Kapoor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [squeezing hand grips] Jim, Jim, Jim. Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh hey, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am gonna be your new boss. [laughs] It's my greatest dream come true. Welcome to the Hotel Hell. Check in time is now. Check out time is never.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Does my room have cable?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. And the sheets are made of fire.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I change rooms?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sorry, we're all booked up. Hell convention in town.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I have a late checkout?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll have to talk to the manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not the manager even in your own fantasy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm the owner. The co-owner. With Satan!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, just so I understand it, in your wildest fantasy you are in Hell and you are co-running a bed and breakfast with the devil?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I haven't told you my salary yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eighty thousand dollars a year.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Once I'm officially Regional Manager my first order of business will be to demote Jim Halpert. So I will need a new number two. My ideal choice? Jack Bauer. But he is unavailable. Fictional. And overqualified.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [signing interview sheet] I will see you at the inter-view.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes you will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who is D. Abramson?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's from that company in Pitts...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [walks through front door] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why... are you here?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm good. How are you, Janet? It's good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm great. Uh, can we, can we talk... privately... for a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why privately?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I just, [quietly] I uh... I don't uh... I, I don't, I don't like the way that we left things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, sure, fine. Um, why don't you wait in my office. I have some important business matters to take care of.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, Defcon ten. Houston, we have a problem.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you want me to do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I may need some immediate assistance. If you would slowly and quietly gather the ladies in the conference room. Phyllis, Angela, Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. She's an alternate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, how you been?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Been good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Sorry to drop by unexpectedly. I uh, I tried calling, but I kept getting voice mail.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Weird. Yeah, I didn't get both of your messages.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, um, Michael needs us in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: 'Cause of Jan again?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, before I leave tonight, would you mind making a half a dozen copies of Jim's and my sales reports for our interviews tomorrow?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, sure.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really hope you get the job.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks. [looks suspicious]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: After you ended... everything with us, I went on a vacation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: To kinda clear my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sound good. Sounds fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was. Yeah, it was good. [laughs] I think I'll just get right to the point, you know? Um, I, I feel good about myself for the first time in a really long time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm..

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I've made some big changes in my life and... I miss you. I want us to get back together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you excuse me for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ohh... [Michael leaves and walks into conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Defcon twenty. She wants to get back together.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are you gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, that's why you're here, help me. Please...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Do you want to get back together with her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. What do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just don't get back together with her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What if she makes me?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How can she make you get back together with her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She made me do a lot of things I didn't wanna do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This was a terrible relationship. You were not happy when you were with her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're so much happier now. Just go in there and be strong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right. You're absolutely right. I'm gonna go in there and tell her that we can't be together.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm in a very good place right now. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks back into office with Jan] Okay. [clears throat] Jan, we need to talk. [Jan turns revealing that she has had her breasts enlarged]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan is in a different place right now, and it is a sign of maturity to give people second chances. So I am going to hear her out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God. [mouths to Jim] Huge!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, bigger actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers] That's crazy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [mouths] Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [moves to block Jim from Pam's eyeline] Oh my God. Can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She could put the cup right there.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I know!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it's fine. I'm sure it must have been weird for Jim when Roy and I were joking around... that one time.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I would never do that. Waste of money. In my experience, guys are way more attracted to the back of you than the front.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I love fake boobs. Often times, you find them on strippers.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I find it offensive. Au natural, baby. That's how I like 'em. Swing low, sweet chariots.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So... [exhales] there are a lot of things that I would like to do differently.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I feel like, when we first got together, that I had a problem with my priorities.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: First got priorities.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And if we could talk about a way to approach a possible reconciliation...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's get back together. [Jan smiles and laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no, no. I'll tell you this, it is not because of the boob job. Excuse me, boob enhancement. That would be shallow. And this is the opposite of shallow. This is... emotionally magnificent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, everyone, listen up! [claps] Time to begin the interview process! [looks at sign-up sheet, only contains Andy's name] Andrew Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saving the best for first!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: All right, you guys. See you later, wish us luck!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! Hey, hey, hey, hey! Do not wish them luck. Do not wish them luck. All luck must be wished unto Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good luck, you guys! [everyone wishes them luck]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did I say!?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm happy for him. I hope he gets the job. I really just want him to be happy. And I know that sounds cliche. And I know saying it sounds cliche, sounds cliche... Maybe I'm being cliche. I don't care. Cause I am what I am. [thinks] That's Popeye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am going to begin this process with a simple test of intelligence and mental dexterity. What is the best color?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: White, because it contains all other colors.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. Black. It is the most dominant. How do you make a table?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You make a chair, but you don't sit on it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is the capital of Maine?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The capital of Maine is Montpelier, Vermont, which is near Ithaca, New York, where I went to Cornell.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, also, moratorium on Cornell talk. Don't wanna hear about it. Forget your personal history, and learn the history of this company.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Should not be a problem. I minored in history in the Ivy League school which I attended.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not off to a very good start, Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I agree. But in another way, I am off to a very good start, wouldn't you say?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am a great interviewee. Why? Because I have something no one else has: my brain. Which I use to my advantage, when advantageous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Andy and Dwight arm-wrestle, Andy is about to win] Time! No, you failed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This interview is over. I'll let you know.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [Driving to New York] Hey, thank you so much for driving me down for my interview.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Totally, no problem. What are you interviewing for, by the way, my assistant? Or...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, you know I'm gonna have a congratulations Karen party um, tomorrow night at my friend's house.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh wow, that sounds like fun. Is your friend named Karen too? What did she accomplish?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: No, I'm sorry I should have been clearer. It's for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: 'Cause I'm going to get the job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding Jan's breasts] Remarkable.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. Check one more time.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very good [Jan nods]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I um, I have to get back, but I will see you in New York tomorrow, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, indeed.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good luck with your interview. [whispers] Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, I guess we're getting back together.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your advice was good, but Jan's was bigger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's the sitch. Two weeks ago, I was in the worst relationship of my life. She treated me poorly. We didn't connect, I was miserable. Now, I'm in the best relationship of my life with the same woman. Love is a mystery.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So we have all night. Where do you want to go first?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I dunno, how about the U.N.?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: How often do you come here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, everytime my sixth grade class has a field trip.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I think you'll really enjoy this, adult Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, everybody. The next time you see me, I'll be working for corporate. Starting tomorrow, Dwight Schrute will be running the branch. So without further ado, [clicks on small tape player] I would like to start saying my goodbyes [Song: Thank You, by Natalie Merchant plays in background] Okay. Goodnight, and good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight clicks off tape player] Who's ready to work?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Karen punches buttons on an ATM] Yeah, we went to the Spotted Pig for dinner. It's in the Village. Uh, Karen knew it. And then we second acted Spamalot. That's when you sneak in at intermission with all the smokers. And then we went to a bar that used to be a church. Oh and at this one bar, I swear I saw Lorne Michaels.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That wasn't him. [Jim nods, mouths, yes, it was]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So what's going to happen to us when I get this job?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh do you mean when I get the job?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Well, if you get the job then I'd move here with you. Would you move with me? I'm not stupid. I was at the beach. We won't have a future in Scranton. There's one too many people there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You mean Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Exactly. But you get it, right? Can't stay there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I do. C'mon. [they hold hands and cross street]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales] How are you guys doing? Need anything?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, no, we're good. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have been here a bunch of times, so I know where everything is, know everybody's names. If you need to know somebody's name, just ask me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [points at bearded man] Who's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is Beardy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Beardy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna introduce myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, just... that's not his real name. That's just what I call him, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am by far the most qualified person they're interviewing. Jim and Karen are here, which is cute. They're like, kid actors tagging along with daddy, on the big audition, hoping to be discovered. Except daddy... is the best actor around. Daddy is Meryl Streep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael is gone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hail to the chief!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My first order of business: make Andrew Bernard my number two.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My first order of business: accept.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: As if you had a choice. [scoffs] Duh. [scoffs] Opportunity of a lifetime. [spits chew into Michael's World's Best Boss mug]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Three months ago, I was nowhere. I was just a Cornell grad, in anger management. Look where I am now. Not bad. [washing out Michael's mug]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hunter! Wha's up my brutha? This is Hunter, secretary extraordinaire.

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Uh, administrative assistant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan in yet?

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: I think she's comin' in... later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could you give her a message for me, when she gets in?

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just say, "I want to squeeze them." It's code. She'll know what it means.

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, and Hunter? Could you tell her, [Michael shakes his head and makes the "motorboat" noise] "Brbrbrbrbr!" also?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You showed great leadership potential at the coal walk. Even if you did follow it with that embarrassing personal confession.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had to make Andy my number two. It's political, complicated, you wouldn't understand. I want you... to be Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, in a sense. Although, publicly I am going to retain the Assistant Regional Manager position.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You will be your own assistant.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Correct, I need someone I can trust. But I would also like the title... to be secretly applied to you. Just stripped of its pomp and frills.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. So... you would be the Regional Manager, and the Assistant Regional Manager. Andy is your number two. I would be the Secret Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmmmmm, let's call it Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you accept?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Absolutely, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I learned from Jim, if Dwight ever asks you to accept something secret... you reply, "Absolutely, I do."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocks on door] Hello, hello!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, good to see you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good to see you. Here are the post-merger performance stats that you asked for.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh, great. I've been meaning to thank you by the way. You didn't lose a single customer during the merger, and you still managed to trim the budget? That is nice work. [Michael smiles] So, let me ask you a question right off the bat. What do you think are your greatest strengths as a manager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't I tell you what my greatest weaknesses are? I work too hard. I care too much. And sometimes I can be too invested in my job.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay. And your strengths?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, my weaknesses are actually... strengths.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh. Yes. Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight is our new boss.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael's not going anywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then who do you think will get the job?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Karen. She looks corporate. Those little pants suits.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think it's gonna be Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Do you really think he's qualified for that job?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, but he wasn't qualified for the job he has now, and he got that one.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughs] Mm. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen up! Come to the center of the room, please. This... [holds up paper that resemles a sheet sized dollar bill with Dwight's face in the middle] is a Schrute Buck. When you have done something good, you will receive one Schrute Buck. One thousand Schrute Bucks... equals an extra five minutes for lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [raises hand] What is the cash value of a Schrute Buck?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent question, Pam. 1/100th of a cent.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So ten thousand of your dollars is worth one real dollar?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just... zip your lid! Another announcement. Michael wasted an enormous amount of the group's time and patience with non-work related ethnic celebrations and parades of soft-minded dogoodedness. No longer. No more meetings!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Amen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Instead, today I will begin my first lecture in a long series of lectures designed to increase your knowledge on the world of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Do we have to?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Michael is gone. There's a new sheriff here in these offices, and his name is "me." Conference room! Ten seconds! All of you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I literally cannot wait to see what Dwight has planned. And I wish Jim were here.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What do you think we could be doing better?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've never been a big fan of the name Dunder Mifflin. I was thinking we could name the company something like, "Paper Great. Where great paper is our passion. We're GRRRRRRRRRREAT!" I don't know, could be good. Or, uh, "Super Duper Paper. It's super duper." I don't know, something like that.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Thanks for comin' in, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: It is always a treat when our paths cross.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is always a treat when our paths cross. So, oh! Before I forget, I wanted to let you know, if you hadn't already heard, uh, Jan and I are back together. So... I may need to fill out one of those love documents again.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You're back together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. And I am very excited about the prospect of working under her... or on top of her. [laughs] Mm, that's not sexual, just... we're all professionals.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, uh. Well, I thought it was clear in the description, the position... the job you're applying for... is Jan's job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand. So, we're gonna tag team it?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, we're letting Jan go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen up. Let's start... from the ground up. Where does paper come from?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [at the same time as Dwight] Trees.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Trees! And where do trees grow?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [at the same time as Dwight] Forest.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Soil. Right. We have, in front of you here, seven different types of Pennsylvania top soil. Now, what would you say... is the most important element in the production of above ground leafy growth? Probably phosphorus, right? [Angela smiles, shakes her head "no"] Wrong! It's nitrogen! Absorb this information. Good! Now, let us discuss precipitation. Stanley! When rainfall occurs, does it usually fall in a liquid, solid, or gaseous... state?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Liquid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very good! You have earned one Schrute Buck.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't want it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then you have been deducted 50 Schrute Bucks!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Make it 100.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We-- Don't you wanna earn Schrute Bucks?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No. In fact, I'll give you a billion Stanley Nickels if you never talk to me again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's the ratio of Stanley Nickels to Schrute Bucks?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: The same as the ratio of unicorns to leprechauns.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Class is canceled, everybody out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No wait, what are you doing?!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm punishing them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, wait! Class is not canceled.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [grumbling, getting loud]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: HEY! COME ON! Let's listen to Dwight's presentation! [Dwight winks at Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What-- What are you winking for?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Zip your lid!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So, that's... my basic 5 year plan. And after that, who knows?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay. Uh, now, this may seem like an odd question, but...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: ...what do you think about Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: He's a very nice man. And he's very well suited for the job he has now.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: This is off the record.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: He would be disaster.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hey you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How was your interview?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could have gone better I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh. [they kiss] I'll put in a good word for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. Maybe you should do it sooner rather than later.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Daaah, let's just run away together. Let's just run away to Jamaica and live in a bungalow. You have some savings right? You could pay off my debts. It would... be fine. We'd have fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What's... what's the matter? What... what happened in there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Tell me what?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You son of a bitch!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jan, this isn't the time, we're in an interview--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You're firing me? Where the hell do you get off?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Frankly, it's overdue. Your behavior in the last two years has been completely erratic.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Erratic?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Recently, you don't even show an interest in your work! You smoke constantly in your office. You spend most of the day online shopping. You disappear for hours at a time, sometimes days. Always saying you're visiting your sister in Scottsdale. You go to Scranton far more often than you used to--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [opens up her overcoat] Is it because of these?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wuuuoooh, hey, whoa, Jan--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, I wanna know. I wanna know! Because if it is, then, then, then I will see you in court!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: It's not.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: It's not.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: 'Cause he likes them. [points to Michael] Okay? He likes them. And, and that is, that is all I care about.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: The time has come for you to end your professional relationship with this company. You are clearly unstable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! You're unstable!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No-- We're all unstable.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? I'm just not leaving. I'm not leaving. Not leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David, I did not tell her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's like staring into my soul, when I look at this wall.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's like outerspace without the stars, it's so black. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is gonna look so awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's so intimidating! Anyone who comes in here... is gonna have to take me seriously. Abandon all hope, ye who enter here!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughs] Totally!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [giving a hug] Bye Hunter.

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good luck with your band.

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: Oh, thank--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Don't let them change you, okay? [Jan drops several items, Michael and Hunter help pick them up, she starts to walk out the door] So long, [censored].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, I am gonna... give her a ride home. Let me know about the job.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Actually, Michael, I think we're gonna take it in another direction.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, I'm glad we're on the same page. I have a lot of ideas for new directions.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, we're not giving you the job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? That... is actually good... because, um, I don't think I could take... my girlfriend's job. That's not being a good boyfriend. So, I respectfully withdraw my name from consideration. Do you accept my withdrawal?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Very good. I'm glad we are finally on the same page. Still have my job in Scranton, though.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. That's all I ever wanted. These two. [points at Jim and Karen] Either one of them... excellent candidates.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Wow. That was some serious... hardcore... self destruction.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Kinda feel bad for her though.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Don't! She's nuts! [they laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man. You know what? This might take a while. You really don't have to stay, if you don't want.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Okay, good! Because, um, a bunch of my friends are meeting downtown for lunch. And, I was gonna meet them, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Just call me when you're done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Good luck, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: [phone rings, picks up] Dunder Mifflin, this is Grace. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, God! I mean, I just don't understand! It's just so rude, you know? I mean, the absolute nerve of that guy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I know, I'm sorry about that. That was terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, just... No, actually I think it's good, you know? It's fine, actually, I do. I really think it's great that it happened. Because, you know, my work has always been the thing that has gotten in the way of my happiness, so... [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's... [Jan starts crying, high pitched whining] No, don't cry, it's gonna be OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [sobbing] Oh, I know, I know. It's just... I'm sorry. It's just these painkillers that I started taking since the surgery. Ohhh! They make my moods totally unpredictable! Wow! What am I gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] I don't know. [normal volume] Well I guess... you could come and stay at my condo. I think I could back out of the sale. [Jan exhales] Probably get some negative feedback on my eBay profile.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Live together. Actually, wait a minute! This could be great! This could be perfect! You know, my full-time job could be our relationship. I could wear stretch pants and wait for you to come home at 5:15. [laughs] It could work. This could work, really!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the office, imitating the terminator] I'll be baaaaack! And I am baaaack!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How'd it go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, Pam. I'm baaaaaack! For gooood! Kevin Nealon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, may I have your attention please? It is with great honor and privilege that I announce to you that I have officially withdrawn my name for consideration from the corporate job. I know, I know, I know. "Michael, what are you thinking? You were a shoe in." Well, got down there. I nailed the interview. And the strangest thing happened. Why is my office black?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To intimidate my subordinates.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was Andy's idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You shouldn't have taken it. Bad management! Good thing I'm baaaaaack. [laughs] Ryan, coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't do that stuff anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's for me, bimbo. Kids.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I'm back. And I am never, ever going to leave. I am going nowhere. This place... is like... the hospital where I was born, my house, my old age home, and my... graveyard... for my bones.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did... Karen get the job?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to everyone] Back to work. [to Ryan] Still waitin' on that coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wanted to thank you... for helping me, when you held the title, Secret Assistant to the Regional Manager. You served the office with great dignity. [Pam salutes Dwight, Dwight returns the salute]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I don't know what the future holds, but... I'm optimistic. And, uh, I had fun goofing around with Dwight today. Jim and I... are just... too similar. Maybe one day I'll find my own Karen. But-- you-- that is, a, um, you know, not-- A man. A man version. But, uh, until then... I can hold my head up. ... I'm not gay.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I don't know how I feel about hiring a Sixers fan.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I should leave. [pretends to get up] [they laugh]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh, let me ask you a question, Jim. You're clearly a very bright guy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Always hit your numbers, personable, you make a great impression on everyone you meet--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, wait, so is the question "How'd I get to be so awesome?" [laughs] Because, I don't have an answer for you. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh, oh, hey, do you have your quarterly numbers?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: And that, uh, questionnaire. Sorry to make you fill that thing out...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: ...that's a HR formality. We have this very irritating HR guy here, he's probably the only person you're not gonna like. [Jim notices a small note inside his papers, it reads "Jim, Don't forget us when you're famous! Pam" It has a gold medal yogurt lid attached.] Kendall. Ugh. So, first up...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hands David his papers] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: How do you think you function here in New York?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [not thinking clearly because of Pam's note] What's that? Oh, uh, great. You know? I just um, I really appreciate the buildings, and uh, the people, and um, there's just a [sic] energy... New York has, uh... Not to mention, they have places that are open past eight. [David laughs] So that's a... bonus.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You've been in the Scranton branch a long time. [Jim stares at Pam's note] What have you liked most about that place?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [thinks] The friendships.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, we want the person who takes this position to be here for the long haul. So... long haul. Where do you see yourself in ten years?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [flashback to Beach Games] How are your feet?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Medium rare. Thanks. [they laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The real reason that I went to Stamford... was because... I wanted to be... not here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And even though... I came back, I just, I feel like I've never really... come back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I wish you would.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [phone rings, Pam answers] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Just one moment, I'll transfer you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I haven't heard anything, but I bet Jim got the job. I mean, why wouldn't he? He's totally qualified, and smart, everyone loves him... and, if he never comes back again... that's OK. We're friends. And I'm sure we'll stay friends. We just, we never got the timing right. You know? I shot him down, and then he did the same to me, and... But you know what? It's OK. I'm totally fine. Everything is gonna be totally-- [Jim walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam. [to camera] Sorry. [to Pam] Um, are you free for dinner tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Then... it's a date.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to camera, tearing up, smiling] I'm sorry, what was the question?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on phone] So, I know we left the other day on a note of uncertainty. But, after some more thought, I'm very pleased to be able to offer you this job. [laughs] Great! I'm so glad. We're all very excited you're going to be joining us. It'll be nice to have another MBA around here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [on phone, smiling] I'm excited too. Okay. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Who was that?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [still smiling] Nobody. You and I are done.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?! [Ryan smiles and glances at the camera]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Where do you see yourself in ten years?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, [clears throat] I've actually done a lot of thinking about that. And in ten years, I am living in a big house, with my kids. And in this house we have screens on the walls that have famous art on them and I have a remote that works everything, that has like a belt-loop attachment, or in my ear, like a gluetooth. And, because it's the future, I can take just a little tiny pill and get all my vitamins for the whole day.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: A... multivitamin?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I don't know what it's gonna be called, but... my point is, the future of this company is now. And the future... is me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan got fired. And I realized that I could not work for a company that would fire my girlfriend. But more than that, I realized that... I couldn't take a job that would take me away from this place. This is where I belong. This is... my home. And home is where the hardest.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Home is where the heart is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Heart is. That makes a lot more sense. You think they'd help each other out like that at corporate? [Oscar shrugs] I think not!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, if Michael gets the job, I will be so upset, because Dwight used to have a crush on me, so if he's boss, it'll be really awkward.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But if Jim gets it, you should be happy, because you have a crush on him, and he totally doesn't feel the same way, and then he'll be gone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, you know, whatever happens. [Kelly puts her hand on Pam's shoulder] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Pam, he's just not that into you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I know. We talked about it and he told me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, seriously Pam, wake up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly made me realize something. She and I have... nothing in common. And I need more friends.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Define scorched earth policy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When an attacker goes through another country sometimes they wi...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nyah ah! Too long! What is the Dharma Initiative?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is the source of all energy on this planet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. It is a corporation formed by aliens.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm a very good interviewee. Why? Because I have something that nobody else has. And that is... my brain. Which makes me charming, witty, intelligent... [long pause] and quick on my feet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who was the second man on the moon?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Trick question. There was no second man on the moon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Inventor of the cotton gin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Eli Edison.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Talk me through an appendectomy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Step 1, disinfection. Step 2, incision. Step 3, remove the appendix tenderly so it doesn't burst and spread toxic...icity everywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Step 5, [talking over Andy, indistinct] ...the wound.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Re-suture. Sutures, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When is the Paleolithic Age?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is a scented candle?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How is the new boss? Tough. Do people respect him? They have to. Do they like him? Irrelevant. They do not. And I hate them back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: New York real estate. I started by looking for a brownstone, like the Huxtables had, [shakes head] but instead I found this very, very, nice place in Jamaica, Queens, mon. It is on the last stop of the subway, which is wonderful, because if I fall asleep, I still end up at home. It is a suh-weeeet one bedroom. I have a roommate, uh, Vijay Chokalingham, he's a sophomore at Queens College. He actually works in the Indian restaurant right below the apartment, so... free food, and the place always smells like curry. So, win/win.
